details.title: Prime Minister Narendra Modi to address at 8 pm on Covid-19 pandemic
details.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address the nation at 8 pm tonight on issues relating to the COVID-19 pandemic. This will be Modi's second address to countrymen in less than a week as India is ramping up efforts to curtail the spread of the highly contagious virus. (READ MORE)

details.title: COVID-19, a worldwide economic tsunami, to create millions of job losses: Moody's warns
details.content: COVID-19 has created a worldwide economic tsunami and the global economy is engulfed in a serious downturn, according to Moody's Analytics."More financial pain is quickly coming as layoffs mount, businesses curtail investment and retirement nest eggs evaporate," said Mark Zandi, Chief Economist at Moody's. (READ MORE)

details.title: Experts urge India Inc to avoid layoffs, pay cuts for faster recovery
details.content: With the coronavirus pandemic threatening a sharp economic slowdown, experts are suggesting companies to adopt a humane approach in rationalising their expenses without going for across-the-board pay cuts or freezing of hikes to ensure a faster recovery from the slump. (READ MORE)

details.title: 95-year-old Italian grandma oldest to recover: Report
details.content: A 95-year-old woman has became the oldest in Italy to recover from COVID-19, according to a report. Alma Clara Corsini of Modena province was diagnosed with the virus and admitted to the hospital in Pavullo on March 5. Doctors treated her at the facility until she recovered last week without “antiviral therapy,” the report added.

details.title: Deadline for filing of I-T returns extended
details.content: For the financial year 2018-19 last date for filing IT returns will be extended to 30 June 2020. For delayed payments, the interest rate has been reduced from 12 to 9 per cent: Nirmala Sitharaman

details.title: Aadhaar-PAN linking date extended
details.content: Aadhaar pan linking date has been extended from 31st march to 30 june 2020: FM
"Vivaad se Vishwas scheme has also been extended to June 30. From now till 30 June, there is no additional charge of 10 per cent," says Finance Minister

details.title: GST returns filing deadline pushed
details.content: The last date for filing March, April and May 2020 GST returns and also compensation returns all are being extended to 30 June 2020: FM

details.title: Relief to small businesses
details.content: Companies with less than Rs 5 crore turnover, no penalty or interest or late fee will be charged. For bigger companies, which have over Rs 5 crore turnover, interest at a reduced rate of 9 per cent will be charged.

details.title: Relief for imports/exporters
details.content: Customs will be doing its duty 24x7 as an essential service till June 30, 2020, says Sitharaman.

Mandatory requirement of holding board meetings is being relaxed by a period of 60 days, this relaxation is for the next two quarters.

details.title: Tamil Nadu records first death due to coronavirus
details.content:
A coronavirus patient has died in Tamil Nadu. This is the first death in the southern state due to the global pandemic.TN Health Minister Dr C Vijayabaskar tweeted the unfortunate news in the wee hours of Wednesday.

#update: Despite our best efforts, the #COVID19 +ve Pt at MDU, #RajajiHospital, passed away few minutes back.He had medical history of prolonged illness with steroid dependent COPD, uncontrolled Diabetes with Hypertension.@MoHFW_INDIA @CMOTamilNadu #Vijayabaskar

— Dr C Vijayabaskar (@Vijayabaskarofl) March 24, 2020

details.title: Will pray for health, safety of those engaged in combating coronavirus: PM Modi
details.content:
• In a series of tweets, he greeted people on Ugadi, Gudi Padava, Navreh and Sajibu Cheiraoba. "We are celebrating various festivals across India and also the start of a new year as per our traditional calendar. May these auspicious occasions bring good health, happiness and prosperity in our lives," the prime minister said. He also said that as Navratri begins from Wednesday, he would pray for the good health, safety and success of those engaged in combating the deadly virus.
  • "Over the years, I have been worshipping Maa (Durga). This time I pray for the health, safety and success of all the nurses, doctors, medical staff, policemen and media personnel who are engaged in the fight against coronavirus," Modi said.
